snippet.title: Five Business Lessons From Marathon Training
snippet.description: David Schnurman had never run more than 4 miles in his life -- but training for the NYC marathon rejuvenated his mindset and more importantly, his business. read »

snippet.title: How To Survive A Marathon Job Interview
snippet.description: At Forbes.com we’ve run many stories about how to succeed in a job interview. But our pieces assume that you’re going to meet a single hiring manager or at most a few other people. Yet for many job seekers, a bigger challenge comes once they have jumped through the initial [...] read »

snippet.title: Why Do Healthy People Die Running Marathons?
snippet.description: "The cardiac community is divided on this," says Peter A. McCullough, M.D., M.P.H. "But I fall in the camp where I think that everyone involved in serious athletics should have a echocardiogram, just like every woman who gets pregnant has two or three ultrasounds." read »

snippet.title: Kentucky Derby Prospect Runs For Boston Marathon Victims
snippet.description: Named to honor the victims of the Boston Marathon, Wicked Strong also runs to raise money for them. His next stop might be the Kentucky Derby. read »

snippet.title: Top 10 Marathons Worth Traveling For
snippet.description: The world's best places to run 26.2 miles will inspire you to lace up and start training. read »

snippet.title: Rookie Marathon Training Mistakes
snippet.description: Failing to properly prepare can make those 26.2 miles feel even longer. Follow the experts' training tips to avoid the race's most common pitfalls. read »

snippet.title: Boston Marathon: When The Cheering Stopped
snippet.description: The spectators are the heart of the race, and the bomber knew it. read »

snippet.title: Saved By Insurance: 'How I Recovered From Paralysis -- And Ran A Marathon'
snippet.description: No one ever thinks they'll get seriously injured—but for one man, preparing for the worst was the key to recovery. read »

snippet.title: Was The Tel Aviv Marathon Really Too Hot To Handle?
snippet.description: Tel Aviv has seen a purposeful upgrade to its sports infrastructure, as well as to programs such as a city-wide bike rental service, all to encourage more people to become more active. The marathon is as much a part of that effort as it is a mechanism to add to Tel Aviv's culture and image as a “global city.” read »
